com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.drm

Interface IVirtuosoDrmSession<T extends android.media.MediaCrypto>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VirtuosoDrmSession
    public interface IVirtuosoDrmSession<T extends android.media.MediaCrypto>
    Manages a DRM session.

      The error state. getError() can be used to retrieve the cause.

      STATE_OPENED 
      static int STATE_OPENED
      The session is open, but does not yet have the keys required for decryption.

      The session is open, but does not yet have the keys required for decryption.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values
      STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS 
      static int STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS
      The session is open and has the keys required for decryption.

      The session is open and has the keys required for decryption.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values
      STATE_OPENING 
      static int STATE_OPENING
      The session is being opened (i.e.
      static final int STATE_OPENING
      The session is being opened (i.e. IVirtuosoDrmSessionManager.open(IDrmInitData) has been called, but the session is not yet open).
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values
    • Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      getError 
      abstract java.lang.Exception getError()
      Gets the cause of the error state.
      java.lang.Exception getError()
      Gets the cause of the error state.

      This method may be called when the manager is in any state.

      Returns:
      An exception if the state is STATE_ERROR. Null otherwise.
      getLicenseKeySetId 
      abstract byte[] getLicenseKeySetId()
      Gets the key set id of the offline license which is loaded for the current session
      byte[] getLicenseKeySetId()
      Gets the key set id of the offline license which is loaded for the current session
      Returns:
      The key set id.
      getMediaCrypto 
      abstract T getMediaCrypto()
      Gets an MediaCrypto for the open session.
      T getMediaCrypto()
      Gets an MediaCrypto for the open session.

      This method may be called when the manager is in the following states: STATE_OPENED, STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS

      Returns:
      An MediaCrypto for the open session.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If called when a session isn't opened.
      getSessionId 
      abstract byte[] getSessionId()
      Returns the session id of the offline license session
      byte[] getSessionId()
      Returns the session id of the offline license session
      Returns:
      The session id
      getState 
      abstract int getState()
      Gets the current state of the session.
      int getState()
      Gets the current state of the session.
      Returns:
      One of STATE_ERROR, STATE_CLOSED, STATE_OPENING, STATE_OPENED and STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS.
      queryKeyStatus 
      abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> queryKeyStatus()
      Returns a map describing the key status for the session.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> queryKeyStatus()
      Returns a map describing the key status for the session. See MediaDrm.queryKeyStatus(byte[])
      Returns:
      requiresSecureDecoderComponent 
      abstract boolean requiresSecureDecoderComponent(java.lang.String mimeType)
      Whether the session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.
      boolean requiresSecureDecoderComponent(java.lang.String mimeType)
      Whether the session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.

      Normally this method should return MediaCrypto.requiresSecureDecoderComponent(String), however in some cases implementations may wish to modify the return value (i.e. to force a secure decoder even when one is not required).

      This method may be called when the manager is in the following states: STATE_OPENED, STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS

      Returns:
      Whether the open session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If called when a session isn't opened.
      setLooper 
      abstract void setLooper(android.os.Looper looper)
      Sets a looper from the media player which can handle MediaDrm requests for key renewals
      void setLooper(android.os.Looper looper)
      Sets a looper from the media player which can handle MediaDrm requests for key renewals
      Parameters:
      looper - The Looper associated with the media playback thread on which a handle can be registered to handle key requests.
